qahramon

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Item
      • qahramon.Weapon

  • public class Weapon
extends Item
    A class of weapons as special kinds of items involving damage.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariant:
    Each weapon must have a valid damage.
        isValidDamage(getDamage())

      Weapon(int damage, float weight, int value)
      Create a weapon with given damage, weight and value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(int damage,
              float weight,
              int value)
        Create a weapon with given damage, weight and value.
        Parameters:
        damage - the damage of this weapon
        weight - the weight of this weapon
        value - the value of this weapon
        Precondition:
        The given damage must be valid.
            isValidDamage(damage)
        Postcondition:
        The damage is set to the given damage.
            new.getDamage() == damage
        Effect:
        The new weapon is set as an item with the given weight and value.
            super(weight, value)

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(int damage,
              float weight)
        Create a weapon with given damage and value.
        Parameters:
        damage - the damage of this weapon
        weight - the weight of this weapon
        Precondition:
        The given damage must be valid.
            isValidDamage(damage)
        Postcondition:
        The damage is set to the given damage.
            new.getDamage() == damage
        Effect:
        The new weapon is set as an item with given weight and zero as value.
            super(weight, 0)

    • Method Detail

      • isWeapon

        @Basic
 @Immutable
 @Raw
public boolean isWeapon()
        Check whether this item is a weapon.
        Overrides:
        isWeapon in class Item
        Returns:
        Always return true since this item is a weapon.
            result == true

      • canHaveAsIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is a valid one.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given identification number is positive, divisible by 6. Return false otherwise.
            result == ((identification >= 0) && (identification%6 == 0))

      • canHaveAsNewIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsNewIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is valid and unique.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsNewIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when this weapon can have the given identification number that has to be unique. Return false otherwise.
            result == canHaveAsIdentification (identification)    && !weaponIds.contains(identification)
        Note:
        Uniqueness is always considered true, the chance of colliding is not zero, but neglectable (6.5*10^(-19)).

      • isValidDamage

        public static boolean isValidDamage(int damage)
        Check whether the given damage is valid.
        Parameters:
        damage - the damage to check
        Returns:
        Return true if the given damage is divisible by seven, greater than 1 and smaller than 100. Return false otherwise.
            (damage >= MIN_DAMAGE && damage <= MAX_DAMAGE && damage % 7 == 0)

      • getDamage

        @Basic
public int getDamage()
        Return the damage of this weapon.
        Returns:
        Return the damage of this weapon.

      • upgrade

        public void upgrade(int amount)
             throws TerminatedException
        Upgrade the weapon to a higher damage.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to upgrade the weapon damage with
        Preconditions:
      • The given amount must be positive.
            amount >= 0
      • The result has to be valid.
            isValidDamage(this.getDamage() + amount)
        • Postcondition:
        The damage of the weapon is incremented with the given amount
            new.getDamage() == this.getDamage() + amount
        Throws:
        TerminatedException - Throws this exception when this weapon is terminated. | isTerminated()

      • downgrade

        public void downgrade(int amount)
               throws TerminatedException
        Downgrade the weapon to a lower damage.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to decrease the damage with
        Preconditions:
      • the given amount must be positive
            amount >= 0
      • the result has to be valid
            isValidDamage(this.getDamage() - amount)
        • Postcondition:
        The damage of the weapon is decremented with the given amount
            new.getDamage() == this.getDamage() - amount
        Throws:
        TerminatedException - Throws this exception when this weapon is terminated. | isTerminated()

      • getValue

        @Raw
public int getValue()
        Return the value of the weapon.
        Overrides:
        getValue in class Item
        Returns:
        When a value was given in the constructor, return that value.
            result == super.getValue()
        Returns:
        When no value was given in the constructor, return the value as its function: damage of the weapon times the defined value factor. The result will be clamped between the value boundaries of this class.
            result == this.getDamage()*VALUE_FACTOR
